title: How to Draw Accurate Human Body Proportions

steps.title: Draw 7 circles of about the same size.
steps.content: Draw 7 circles of about the same size. These will be your guidelines. Some people prefer to start with 8 circles since it's easier to grasp the alignments of the anatomy. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Draw an oval parallel to the topmost circle.
steps.content: Draw an oval parallel to the topmost circle. This will be the head.

steps.title: Halfway down the second circle from the top, add a horizontal line.
steps.content: Halfway down the second circle from the top, add a horizontal line. This is where the shoulder stops.

steps.title: Halfway down the third circle, draw another horizontal line.
steps.content: Halfway down the third circle, draw another horizontal line. This is where the waist will be, and also where the elbows end.

steps.title: Halfway down the fourth circle, end the torso.
steps.content: Halfway down the fourth circle, end the torso.

steps.title: Halfway down the fifth circle, end the fingertips.
steps.content: Halfway down the fifth circle, end the fingertips. Draw the beginning of the wrists about where the torso ends.

steps.title: Just past the top of the sixth circle, end the knees.
steps.content: Just past the top of the sixth circle, end the knees. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Finish the bottom of the feet where the last circle ends.
steps.content: Finish the bottom of the feet where the last circle ends. That's it!
